criteria: Ability to identify key features (intercepts, maxima, minima, symmetry, end behavior, and periodicity) from different representations (algebraic, graphical, numerical, verbal).
Skill in comparing properties of two functions presented in different forms.
Justification and reasoning in comparing properties.
descriptions: Student cannot identify any key features from any representation.
Student can identify some key features from only one representation.
Student can identify most key features from one representation or some key features from multiple representations.
Student can identify most key features from multiple representations.
Student can accurately identify almost all key features from various representations.
Student can accurately and thoroughly identify all key features from various representations, demonstrating a deep understanding.
Student cannot compare properties of functions presented in different forms.
Student can compare basic properties (e.g., intercepts) with significant difficulty.
Student can compare some properties with some accuracy but struggles with more complex features.
Student can compare most properties of the functions, identifying similarities and differences.
Student demonstrates a strong ability to compare properties, accurately identifying similarities and differences and providing some justification.
Student demonstrates a sophisticated ability to compare properties, providing insightful analysis and justification.
No justification or reasoning is provided.
Limited and unclear justification is provided.
Justification is provided but may contain inaccuracies or lack depth.
Clear justification is provided, supporting most comparisons.
Well-reasoned and accurate justification is provided, enhancing the comparison.
Comprehensive and insightful justification is provided, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the functions' properties.
